intro: Tetradymia comosa subsp. tetrameres, commonly known as the woolly tetrads, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive foliage. The plant features dense, woolly hairs on its leaves and stems, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow and bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This subspecies is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
